2:T8cd,{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Recipe","name":"Fainá","description":"A thin, crispy chickpea flour flatbread that's the classic companion to Buenos Aires pizza. Served as a slab placed directly on top of a pizza slice — a combination that every porteño knows and loves.","image":"https://expatsargentina.com/images/recipes/faina.webp","author":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Expats Argentina"},"datePublished":"2025-01-01","prepTime":"PT10M","cookTime":"PT20M","totalTime":"PT30M","recipeYield":"6 servings","recipeCategory":"appetizer","recipeCuisine":"Argentine","keywords":"faina recipe, argentine faina, chickpea flatbread, faina buenos aires, faina pizza","nutrition":{"@type":"NutritionInformation","calories":"190 calories","proteinContent":"7g","carbohydrateContent":"22g","fatContent":"9g"},"recipeIngredient":["2 cups (200g) chickpea flour (harina de garbanzos)","2 cups (475ml) water","3 tbsp olive oil (plus more for the pan)","1 tsp salt","1/2 tsp black pepper"],"recipeInstructions":[{"@type":"HowToStep","position":1,"text":"Whisk chickpea flour and water together in a bowl until completely smooth with no lumps. Stir in olive oil, salt, and pepper."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":2,"text":"Cover the batter and let it rest at room temperature for at least 1 hour. This hydrates the chickpea flour and improves texture. Skim off any foam that forms on top."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":3,"text":"Preheat oven to 475°F (245°C). Place a 14-inch round baking pan or cast-iron skillet in the oven to heat for 10 minutes."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":4,"text":"Carefully remove the hot pan and coat generously with olive oil."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":5,"text":"Pour the batter into the hot, oiled pan — it should sizzle. The batter should be about 1/4 inch thick."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":6,"text":"Bake on the top rack for 15-20 minutes until the surface is golden and slightly crackled, with darker spots around the edges."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":7,"text":"Remove and let cool for 2 minutes. Cut into slices and serve immediately."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":8,"text":"To eat like a true porteño, place a slice of fainá directly on top of a slice of muzzarella pizza."}]}0:{"buildId":"XJ7f5RvYDcX4yjbAXmNYG","rsc":["$","$1","c",{"children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"min-h-screen bg-gradient-to-b from-orange-50 to-white","children":[["$","script",null,{"type":"application/ld+json","dangerouslySetInnerHTML":{"__html":"$2"}}],["$","div",null,{"className":"border-b bg-white/80 backdrop-blur-sm sticky top-0 z-40 print:hidden","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"max-w-5xl mx-auto px-4 py-4","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"flex items-center justify-between","children":["$","$L3",null,{"href":"/food/recipes","children":[["$","svg",null,{"xmlns":"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg","width":24,"height":24,"viewBox":"0 0 24 24","fill":"none","stroke":"currentColor","strokeWidth":2,"strokeLinecap":"round","strokeLinejoin":"round","className":"lucide lucide-arrow-left w-4 h-4","aria-hidden":"true","children":[["$","path","1l729n",{"d":"m12 19-7-7 7-7"}],["$","path","x3x0zl",{"d":"M19 12H5"}],"$undefined"]}],"All Recipes"],"data-slot":"button","data-variant":"ghost","data-size":"sm","className":"inline-flex items-center justify-center whitespace-nowrap text-sm font-medium transition-all disabled:pointer-events-none disabled:opacity-50 [&_svg]:pointer-events-none [&_svg:not([class*='size-'])]:size-4 shrink-0 [&_svg]:shrink-0 outline-none focus-visible:border-ring focus-visible:ring-ring/50 focus-visible:ring-[3px] aria-invalid:ring-destructive/20 dark:aria-invalid:ring-destructive/40 aria-invalid:border-destructive hover:bg-accent hover:text-accent-foreground dark:hover:bg-accent/50 h-8 rounded-md px-3 has-[>svg]:px-2.5 gap-2","ref":null}]}]}]}],"$L4","$L5","$L6"]}],null,"$L7"]}],"loading":null,"isPartial":false}

Skim off any foam that forms on top."}]]}],["$","li","2",{"className":"flex gap-4","children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"flex-shrink-0 w-8 h-8 rounded-full bg-orange-100 text-orange-600 flex items-center justify-center font-bold text-sm","children":3}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700 leading-relaxed pt-1","children":"Preheat oven to 475°F (245°C). Place a 14-inch round baking pan or cast-iron skillet in the oven to heat for 10 minutes."}]]}],["$","li","3",{"className":"flex gap-4","children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"flex-shrink-0 w-8 h-8 rounded-full bg-orange-100 text-orange-600 flex items-center justify-center font-bold text-sm","children":4}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700 leading-relaxed pt-1","children":"Carefully remove the hot pan and coat generously with olive oil."}]]}],["$","li","4",{"className":"flex gap-4","children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"flex-shrink-0 w-8 h-8 rounded-full bg-orange-100 text-orange-600 flex items-center justify-center font-bold text-sm","children":5}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700 leading-relaxed pt-1","children":"Pour the batter into the hot, oiled pan — it should sizzle. The batter should be about 1/4 inch thick."}]]}],["$","li","5",{"className":"flex gap-4","children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"flex-shrink-0 w-8 h-8 rounded-full bg-orange-100 text-orange-600 flex items-center justify-center font-bold text-sm","children":6}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700 leading-relaxed pt-1","children":"Bake on the top rack for 15-20 minutes until the surface is golden and slightly crackled, with darker spots around the edges."}]]}],["$","li","6",{"className":"flex gap-4","children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"flex-shrink-0 w-8 h-8 rounded-full bg-orange-100 text-orange-600 flex items-center justify-center font-bold text-sm","children":7}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700 leading-relaxed pt-1","children":"Remove and let cool for 2 minutes. Cut into slices and serve immediately."}]]}],"$L13"]}]}]]}],"$L14","$L15","$L16"]}]

13:["$","li","7",{"className":"flex gap-4","children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"flex-shrink-0 w-8 h-8 rounded-full bg-orange-100 text-orange-600 flex items-center justify-center font-bold text-sm","children":8}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700 leading-relaxed pt-1","children":"To eat like a true porteño, place a slice of fainá directly on top of a slice of muzzarella pizza."}]]}]
14:["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card","className":"text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm bg-gradient-to-br from-amber-50 to-orange-50 border-amber-100 print:bg-none print:border-gray-300","id":"tips","children":[["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-header","className":"@container/card-header grid auto-rows-min grid-rows-[auto_auto] items-start gap-2 px-6 has-data-[slot=card-action]:grid-cols-[1fr_auto] [.border-b]:pb-6","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-title","className":"font-semibold flex items-center gap-2 text-xl","children":[["$","svg",null,{"xmlns":"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg","width":24,"height":24,"viewBox":"0 0 24 24","fill":"none","stroke":"currentColor","strokeWidth":2,"strokeLinecap":"round","strokeLinejoin":"round","className":"lucide lucide-lightbulb w-5 h-5 text-amber-600","aria-hidden":"true","children":[["$","path","1gvzjb",{"d":"M15 14c.2-1 .7-1.7 1.5-2.5 1-.9 1.5-2.2 1.5-3.5A6 6 0 0 0 6 8c0 1 .2 2.2 1.5 3.5.7.7 1.3 1.5 1.5 2.5"}],["$","path","x1upvd",{"d":"M9 18h6"}],["$","path","ceow96",{"d":"M10 22h4"}],"$undefined"]}],"Pro Tips from the Kitchen"]}]}],["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6","children":["$","ul",null,{"className":"space-y-3","children":[["$","li","0",{"className":"flex items-start gap-3","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"text-amber-500 mt-1","children":"✦"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700","children":"The resting time is essential — skipping it results in a gritty texture. One hour minimum, two hours is even better."}]]}],["$","li","1",{"className":"flex items-start gap-3","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"text-amber-500 mt-1","children":"✦"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700","children":"The pan must be screaming hot when you pour in the batter — this is what creates the crispy bottom."}]]}],["$","li","2",{"className":"flex items-start gap-3","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"text-amber-500 mt-1","children":"✦"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700","children":"Fainá should be thin (under 1/4 inch). If it's thick, it becomes cakey instead of crispy."}]]}]]}]}]]}]
15:["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm print:shadow-none print:border-gray-300","id":"history","children":[["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-header","className":"@container/card-header grid auto-rows-min grid-rows-[auto_auto] items-start gap-2 px-6 has-data-[slot=card-action]:grid-cols-[1fr_auto] [.border-b]:pb-6","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-title","className":"font-semibold flex items-center gap-2 text-xl","children":[["$","svg",null,{"xmlns":"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg","width":24,"height":24,"viewBox":"0 0 24 24","fill":"none","stroke":"currentColor","strokeWidth":2,"strokeLinecap":"round","strokeLinejoin":"round","className":"lucide lucide-history w-5 h-5 text-orange-600","aria-hidden":"true","children":[["$","path","1357e3",{"d":"M3 12a9 9 0 1 0 9-9 9.75 9.75 0 0 0-6.74 2.74L3 8"}],["$","path","1xhq8a",{"d":"M3 3v5h5"}],["$","path","1fdv2h",{"d":"M12 7v5l4 2"}],"$undefined"]}],"The Story Behind the Dish"]}]}],["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6","children":["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700 leading-relaxed","children":"Fainá comes from the Genovese farinata, a chickpea flatbread that Italian immigrants brought to Argentina in the late 1800s. In Genoa it was poor people's food; in Buenos Aires it became a beloved companion to pizza. The tradition of placing a slice of fainá on top of a slice of pizza is uniquely Argentine — you'll see it in every pizzería in the city. It's always ordered by the slice, standing at the counter."}]}]]}]
16:["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm print:shadow-none print:border-gray-300","children":[["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-header","className":"@container/card-header grid auto-rows-min grid-rows-[auto_auto] items-start gap-2 px-6 has-data-[slot=card-action]:grid-cols-[1fr_auto] [.border-b]:pb-6 pb-3","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-title","className":"font-semibold text-lg","children":"Storage & Leftovers"}]}],["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6 pt-0","children":["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700","children":"Best eaten fresh and hot. Leftovers can be reheated in a very hot oven for 5 minutes but will lose some crispness. Does not freeze well."}]}]]}]
